title: Interpret Precision and Recall in results.png
body: ## ‚ùîQuestion I am trying to compare YoloV3 and EfficientDet models and I get the results something like shown below for each epoch on EfficientDet Model (COCO Evaluation results): Average Precision (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= all | maxDets=100 ] = 0.55046 Average Precision (AP) @[ IoU=0.50 | area= all | maxDets=100 ] = 0.72925 Average Precision (AP) @[ IoU=0.75 | area= all | maxDets=100 ] = 0.60224 Average Precision (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= small | maxDets=100 ] = 0.39836 Average Precision (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area=medium | maxDets=100 ] = 0.59854 Average Precision (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= large | maxDets=100 ] = 0.68405 Average Recall (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= all | maxDets= 1 ] = 0.40256 Average Recall (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= all | maxDets= 10 ] = 0.66929 Average Recall (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= all | maxDets=100 ] = 0.72943 Average Recall (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= small | maxDets=100 ] = 0.59943 Average Recall (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area=medium | maxDets=100 ] = 0.76873 Average Recall (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= large | maxDets=100 ] = 0.84460 The training results file from the Yolo model has plot as below: Following the results explanations [https://cocodataset.org/#detection-eval ](https://cocodataset.org/#detection-eval) my understand is that plotting Average Precision (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= all | maxDets=100 ] and Average Precision (AP) @[ IoU=0.50 | area= all | maxDets=100 ] for each epoch is equivalent to mAP@0.5 and mAP@0.5:0.95 plot in the result image. But how is the Precision, and Recall calculated and plotted in the training results diagram for the Yolo model? And Is there any equivalence between the COCO Evaluation results and the training result plots from Yolo Model? ## Additional context
